title: The Brood of Erys
author: Andrew Smith
filename: 183 - The Brood of Erys - Andrew Smith_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1. SPACECRAFT INTERIOR.
(FX: A COMPACT, METAL WALLED SPACE. A SUBTLE HYPNOTIC TONE IN
THE BACKGROUND. )
Who are you?
(PUZZLED) I... I am..
What is your name?
My name?
It’s a simple question. Tell me your name.
I... am I... Sarra?
You’re not sure of your own name?
I should be... shouldn’t I?
Do you know who I am? (PAUSE) No? Take a good look. Do you know
me?
I.. No. Who are you?
Never mind, girl. Never mind. It’s time.
FX: THE HYPNOTIC TONE STARTS TO RISE IN VOLUME.
Time?
You must rest just once more.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 3
(FX: THE MACHINE THAT IS THE SOURCE OF THE HYPNOTIC TONE MOVES
US. CLOSER AND CLOSER...)
It’s time to begin.
INTO OPENING THEME.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(FX: THE TARDIS IN FLIGHT. THE ENGINES ARE COMPLETING A
SEQUENCE.
THE DOCTOR OPERATES A NUMBER OF CONTROLS, CONTINUING BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
Where have we landed?
I don’t know for sure. We have materialised in a random part of Space/Time so that I can recalibrate the TARDIS systems. It needs doing, it’s been a long time.
Why somewhere random?
Because, Miss Jackson, when materialising at an arbitrary location the TARDIS conducts a far range scan to pinpoint its position.
FX: A DATA READOUT CHATTERS ACROSS A MONITOR SCREEN.

(CONTINUED) Like so, excellent. Then we move to another random point and take a further reading. By comparing the two sets of data we can assess the accuracy or otherwise of the TARDIS’s chrono-spatial placement.
Kind of like when you first set up a wireless controller for a
games console?
When you first set up a - ? (SIGH) No doubt.
FX: KEYBOARD TAPS. SLOWER, MORE DELIBERATE NOW.
This is odd...
What is?
Curious. Let’s see what’s outside.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 5
FX: THE SCANNER SCREEN OPENS.
Yeah, we’re hanging in space? — Oh, they’re pretty.
According to the TARDIS, that pretty planet and its pretty moon are the only bodies in this system apart from the star that they orbit.
Is that odd? One planet?
It’s rare but not unique. No, what’s odd is that the scan shows there is a ring of radio beacons surrounding this system.
I can’t see any.
Oh they’re far from here, about a hundred and fifty million miles out.
A hundred and fifty million??
That’s less than half the distance from your world to Jupiter. Still, it’s a major feat of technology, to deploy so many beacons around such a vast area of space.
What are they for?
FX: CONSOLE INSTRUMENTS ARE OPERATED.
They’re emitting a signal. Ah, and there’s an audio message. Let’s have a listen.
FX: A SWITCH IS THROWN.

(AUTHORITATIVE) “Keep away. This system is out of bounds by interplanetary decree. If you proceed your life will be in jeopardy, and should you survive you will be subject to the severest sanctions that the law can provide... (A TONE, THEN THE
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 6
RESTARTS) Keep away. This system is out of bounds by interplanetary decree. If you proceed — “
FX: THE SAME SWITCH IS OPERATED, CUTTING OFF THE MESSAGE.
Oh.
“Your life will be in jeopardy?”
It could be a warning of a navigation hazard.
Should we leave?
That might be wise. Although I am curious.
Hey, what are they? On the scanner.
(FX: THROUGH THE SCANNER, MULTIPLE SMALL SPACECRAFT IN THE DISTANCE AND COMING CLOSER, CONTINUING BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
Hmm?
Are they spaceships? See, about ten of them? Little things.
Skimmers.
Skimmers?
Single person, short distance space pods.
They’re heading this way.
Given the warning we just heard, we should exercise caution.
Let’s see if they’1ll speak to us.
FX: A COMMUNICATIONS SWITCH IS ACTIVATED.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 7
(CONTINUED) Approaching skimmers, this is the Doctor on board the blue ship, TARDIS. Can you hear me?
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 3. INT. SKIMMER.
(FX: CRAMPED INTERIOR AMBIENCE. THE SKIMMER’S SMOOTH
TONE RESONATES. A FEW SUBTLE ELECTRONIC COCKPIT CONTROLS
AS THE COURSE IS ADJUSTED BY THE PILOT. )
(RADIO FILTER) I say again, approaching skimmers can you hear me?
BEAT.
(MENTAL PROJECTION) Brothers and sisters we will maintain radio silence. Continue
on approach to the blue box.
FX: THE SKIMMER CONTINUES.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 4. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
FX: THE DOCTOR CLOSES THE COMMUNICATIONS CHANNEL.
Nothing.
They can’t hear you?
Or they choose to ignore me.
They’re almost on top of us. Should we go?
They’re not armed. They’re close enough now for us to be sure of that.
But they are surrounding the TARDIS. I can make out the people inside them. Are they... are they children??
Look again. They’re small, but mature. I don’t recognise the species.
They’re like imps aren’t they? So little. Kind of cute.
Appearances can be deceptive. And remember that warning.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 5. SKIMMER.
(FX: THE SKIMMER IS HANGING IN SPACE, ITS ENGINE TICKING OVER. NEARBY, OTHER SKIMMER ENGINES ARE ALSO IDLING.)
(MENTAL PROJECTION) Brothers and sisters, this is a rare specimen. We shall examine
ch oe
(FX: A CONTROL ACTIVATES, THE CANOPY OPENS. WE HEAR THE
ENGINES OF OTHER SKIMMERS NEARBY.
AND NOW SEVERAL OTHER CANOPIES ALSO OPEN. )
EFFORT OF CLIMBING OUT.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 6. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(WORRIED) What are they climbing out of their ships for?
They can survive in a vacuum.. What? Don’t you dare.
That one’s going to — [jump]
(FX: A SMALL IMPACT, THE CREATURE LANDING ON THE ROOF OF THE TARDIS. )
(CONTINUED) He did! He jumped!
The cheek. (SHOUTING UP) Get off my roof!
(FX: FURTHER SMALL IMPACTS AS OTHERS OF THE CREATURES MAKE THE SAME LEAP.
A FEW SHORT BANGS FROM THE DOOR, THE CREATURES KNOCKING AGAINST IT AS THEY MANOEUVRE.
BEHIND THE FOLLOWING, CONTINUED KNOCKS AND SCUFFLES OF MOVEMENT ON THE ROOF AND OUTSIDE THE DOORS. )
Are they trying to get in?
It’s more that they’re curious about us. The way they’re clambering around, they’re examining the TARDIS.
They’re so quick. And thin. Aww, that one’s smiling. Do you think he knows we’re looking at him?
They are quite childlike, aren’t they?
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 7. TARDIS EXTERIOR.
(FX: THE DRACHEE, LITHE AND NIMBLE, SCAMPERING BAREFOOT AROUND AND OVER THE TARDIS. )
(MENTAL PROJECTION) Brothers and sisters, can you feel the power in this device?
(FX: THE DRACHEE SCAMPER CLOSER TO TERRILL. ONE OF THEM SLIPS.)
CRIES OUT AS HE SLIPS, STARTS TO FALL.
(SPOKEN ALOUD) (REACTING, GRABBING FOR HIS FRIEND) Careful!
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 8. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
Woah, that one almost fell off. His mate just caught him.
It was very close, yes.
It’s not safe for them. I’m opening the doors.
Flip. No!
Opening the door in space can be hideously dangerous! Especially if I haven’t made sure the force-field is operational.
Well, is it?
Is what what?
Is your forcefield thing operational?
Well yes, but--
FX: DOOR CONTROL OPERATES. THE TARDIS MAIN DOORS OPEN.
Flip! We don’t know if we can trust these creatures!
They’re harmless! And you couldn’t dematerialise while they’re out there anyway.
They are perfectly capable of looking after — [themselves]. (FX: THE DRACHEE SWARM IN, ABOUT EIGHT OF THEM. FAST,
LIGHT-FOOTED, FEET AND HANDS BRUSHING THE FLOOR AS THEY PROPEL THEMSELVES ALONG. THEY MAKE AN EXCITED ANIMALISTIC SOUND, A
CHATTER, AMONG THEMSELVES AS THEY ENTER. THEY SPREAD OUT, EXAMINING THE ROOM. CONTINUING BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 14
(CONTINUED) (EXASPERATED) Close the door then, Flip.
FX: TARDIS DOORS CLOSE, BEHIND THE FOLLOWING
(CONTINUED) (WITH BAD GRACE) Welcome! I am the Doctor and this is Flip. Do come in. As an old friend of mine would have said, ‘Liberty Hall’
FX: TERRILL MOVES UP CLOSE TO THE DOCTOR.
(EXPLORATORY SNIFFS OF THE DOCTOR, THEN — ) I am Terrill. My
apologies if my brothers and sisters and I startled you.
I’m glad to make your acquaintance, Terrill. However, if you could just ask your siblings to be careful .. ?
(DELIGHTED) Hello Terrill.
Lady.
Ooh. Lady. I like that.
What is this ship?
It’s called the TARDIS. It can travel in — [time and space]
(A HASTY INTERRUPTION) Yes thank you, Flip.
But how is it big, when outside it is so small? This is
fascinating to us.
It’s fascinating to most people. But — hang on.
(FX: OVER THE ABOVE, A SHORT DISTANCE AWAY THE INNER CONTROL
DOOR IS OPENED.
DRACHEE SCAMPER THROUGH AND OUT.)
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 15
(CONTINUED) Where are those four going? Oh this is too much! Get back in here!
My brothers and sisters are only exploring your ship. They will do no damage.
(CALLING) Get back in here! Oh really this is too much.
It’s all right, Doctor. I’1ll fetch them back. (MOVING AWAY) Oi! You lot!
This is intolerable.
Apologies, Doctor. We Drachee are naturally inquisitive.
You’re called Drachee? I take it you come from that planet?
The planet is Asphya. The moon is Erys. We Drachee are from Erys. You would not like the people of Asphya.
No?
They are a very simple society. No ambition. Farmers. Tsk.
Do the Drachee have ambition?
Some of us do.
Terrill, if life is so simple here, can you explain to me why there is a network of beacons around this system warning other Space travellers not to enter if they value their lives?
There is no danger here.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 16
That doesn’t answer my question.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 9.INT. TARDIS CORRIDOR.
FX: TARDIS AMBIENCE.
LOW, EXCITED CHATTER
(FX: A SMALL GROUP OF DRACHEE ARE STANDING IN A GROUP. A HINGED
IS OPENED. )
INTERESTED, HAPPILY SURPRISED REACTION
FX: FOOTSTEPS APPROACH
(APPROACHING) (FAUX STERN; SHE IS STILL CHARMED BY THESE CREATURES) All right, that’s enough. Come on. Shut that roundy- panel-thingy before you break something.
SULLEN, SULKY ‘OH DO WE HAVE TO?’ REACTION
FX: THE PANEL IS CLOSED.
Honestly, what am I going to do with you? Come on, back to the
control room.
(FX: THE DRACHEE MOVE BACK ALONG THE CORRIDOR, FLIP
THEM. )
MOVING AWAY) (WHISPERED CHATTER.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 10. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(FX: TARDIS AMBIENCE. A FEW DRACHEE STILL SCAMPERING AROUND. A
IS PLAYED WITH, REPEATEDLY SWITCHED ON AND OFF.)
Now really!
Larn. Perska. Bren. Do not break that.
SULLENLY, THEY DESIST.
I’m grateful for your intervention, Terrill. I’d be more grateful if your friends would leave things alone.
They are my brothers and my sisters and they are most interested in your marvellous ship, Doctor.
(FX: THE INNER DOOR OPENS. FLIP AND THE SMALL GROUP OF DRACHEE RETURN. )
(ENTERING) Here you go Doctor. I rounded them up.
Thank you Flip. And Terrill, I’m afraid we must now be on our way.
No.
I beg your pardon?
I said no. We will not leave. We like your ship.
I know you do. But I’m afraid I can’t take you with me.
We do not mean you to take us. You will give us your ship.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 19
What?
(TERRILL NOW MUCH LESS ENDEARING. THE FACADE DROPS AND HE IS DETERMINED. )
It is very simple. We are taking over your ship and you will relinquish it to us.
No. No I won’t.
(FX: A RESONANT TONE, THE POWER OF TERRILL’S MENTAL PROJECTION. )
(MENTAL PROJECTION) (RESONATING, BOOMING IN THE DOCTOR’S MIND) Yes. You will.
CRIES OUT IN AGONY
(MENTAL PROJECTION) You will do as I say, Doctor. I’1l show you. Kneel down.
IN PAIN, STRUGGLING, BUT DRAWN TO HIS KNEES.
Doctor?!
(PAINED, AND EVEN AFRAID) He’s in my head .. Manipulating my memories ...
(MENTAL PROJECTION) Manipulating your fears. There are things you fear a great deal, aren’t there, Doctor?
Stop this .. !
(APPROACHING) Let me help.
(MENTAL PROJECTION) BACK, GIRL.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 20
THROWN BACK VIOLENTLY AGAINST THE WALL, SHE CRIES OUT.
FX: FLIP HITS THE TARDIS WALL.
(THROUGH THE PAIN) Leave her... alone!
(MENTAL PROJECTION ) I will. Once we have your ship, your TARDIS. If you continue to fight, the effort will cause you great pain.
(STRUGGLING BACK TO HIS FEET) We'll... see... about... THAT!
FX: TERRILL’S MENTAL PROJECTION IS BROKEN, THE TONE STOPS.
NO LONGER IN PAIN, HE GATHERS HIS BREATH
SHE ALSO RECOVERS, NO LONGER IN PAIN
This isn’t possible. How did you do that?
(VERY WEAK) I’ve been mind wrestled by far better than you, Terrill. Now.. Get off my TARDIS.
But I want it.
(VERY WEAK) Wanting... isn’t getting.
(FX: A SUDDEN LOUD GRINDING SOUND RESONATES, EMANATING FROM OUTSIDE THE TARDIS AS A MASSIVE GRAVITATIONAL FORCE ACTS ON IT. AFTER A SHORT PERIOD IT CEASES. )
EXCITED CHATTER
What was that?
(FRUSTRATED) It has started.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 21
(FX: THE SOUND RESUMES: GRINDING, STRAINING METAL, CONTINUING
BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
What has started? What’s happening to my TARDIS?
We have to leave. If we can’t have your ship, we’ll have something else you value. Larn. Vana. Bring the girl.
No!
FX: A SCUFFLE AS TWO DRACHEE GRAB HOLD OF FLIP.
(STRUGGLES) Here what are you doing? Let go of me you little —
[FX: AN OBJECT LIKE A LARGE CLOTH SWEEPS THROUGH THE AIR AND
FLIP. THERE IS A RUSH OF OXYGEN. )
A vacuum cloak. You’1l need that.
(MUFFLED FROM INSIDE THE CLOAK) Doctor!
Put her down!
(FX: ANOTHER BURST OF TERRILL’S MENTAL FORCE STRIKES THE DOCTOR. )
(CRIES OUT, STRUGGLES AGAINST THE FORCE) Let... her... go!
You will never see her again. (TO THE DRACHEE) Throw her out. Quickly!
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) Throw me? What?
(FX: THE CLOAK, DRAGGED LIKE A SACK ACROSS THE TARDIS FLOOR WITH FLIP IN IT.)
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) No don’t! I can’t breathe out there!
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 22
You will breathe. That’s the point of the vacuum cloak.
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) Doctor!!
(STRUGGLING WITH MENTAL EFFORT. GAINING THE UPPER HAND) I told you.. Terrill... I am an old hand... at this!
FX: THE TONE OF THE MENTAL PROJECTION AGAIN CUTS OUT.
But it has left you too weak to stop us.
(FAINT, STAGGERS.) No... no...
Do it. Throw her out.
FX: FLIP, IN THE VACUUM CLOAK, IS LIFTED FROM THE FLOOR.
CRIES AS SHE IS THROWN OUT OF THE DOORS, AWAY FROM US.
Everyone. Out. To your skimmers.
EXCITED CHATTERING AS THEY SCRAMBLE OUT.
(FX: THE GROUP OF DRACHEE MOVE SWIFTLY ACROSS THE CONTROL ROOM FLOOR AND THROW THEMSELVES OUT THROUGH THE DOORS.
THE GRINDING, CRUNCHING, STRAINING SOUND GROWS IN VOLUME. )
Doctor. You asked what that sound was? It’s the reason those warning beacons tell people to stay away. If you value your life you’ll leave here if you can. Now.
Flip...
But hurry. Or you and your ship will soon be crushed. Goodbye.
EFFORT OF THROWING HIMSELF THROUGH THE DOORS.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 23
FX: TARDIS DOORS CLOSE.
WEAKLY) Flip. Must... get.. (FALLS UNCONSCIOUS.
FX: THE DOCTOR COLLAPSES ON THE FLOOR.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 11. INT. SKIMMER.
(FX: FLIP IN HER VACUUM CLOAK IS STRUGGLING WITHIN THE CONFINES OF THE SKIMMER.
IN THE BACKGROUND, A THUNDEROUS RUMBLE OF THE IMMENSE
FORCE THAT IS ACTING ON THE TARDIS.)
Stop struggling girl, or you will rip the cloak and die. There is no air until I close the canopy.
FX: THE MOVEMENT WITHIN THE CLOAK STOPS.
CLIMBS IN AND THE CANOPY CLOSES.
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) I can’t see anything. What’s happening?
What’s that noise?
Better you don’t know.
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) Where are you taking me?
You'll see.
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) The Doctor will come and get me.
You’11l never see him again.
FX: THE SKIMMER ENGINE POWERS UP.
(WITHIN THE CLOAK) Doctor!!
FX: THE SKIMMER POWERS AWAY.
(FX: THE ENGINES OF SEVERAL SKIMMERS BUILD IN POWER. THEN THEY
OFF, AWAY FROM US.
THE THUNDEROUS RUMBLING CONTINUES. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 12. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(FX: THE SOUND OF TORTURED METAL REACHES A NEW CRESCENDO,
THROUGH THE ROOM. )
(GROANS, REGAINING CONSCIOUSNESS) Flip... ?
FX: THE DOCTOR SCRAMBLES TO HIS FEET.
(REGAINING HIS WITS RAPIDLY, AWARE OF THE CRISIS) Steady old girl, steady. I know it hurts. Whatever it is. Let’s see if we can find out.
FX: TARDIS CONSOLE INSTRUMENTS ARE OPERATED.
Nothing on the scanner. Or the detectors.
(FX: A THUNDEROUS RUMBLE, METAL JOINTS STRAIN. AN ALARM SOUNDS ON THE CONSOLE. THE DOCTOR CUTS IT OFF.)
Yes yes, that’s all right. I know. The TARDIS is being acted on by an external force. Something that’s crushing the life out of you. Stand by for emergency dematerialisation...
(FX: ANOTHER ALARM SOUNDS. A DIFFERENT ONE. THIS ONE CONTINUES
I said I know, it’s an emergency!.. Wait a minute. That’s one of the proximity alarms. Proximity alarm?
(FX: THROUGH THE SCANNER, THERE IS A SPATIAL DISTURBANCE HEARD ABOVE THE STRUCTURAL COMPLAINTS OF THE TARDIS. SHIMMERING,
SPACE.)
That’s a hyperspace corridor. A ship’s about to arrive here? We’ve got to warn them! They won’t last five minutes if they come out of hyperspace into this.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 13. SPACE.
(FX: THE THUNDERING ROAR OF THE FORCE THAT IS CRUSHING THE
IS IN FULL VIGOUR. NEXT TO IT, THE SHIMMERING DISTURBANCE OF THE HYPERSPACE CORRIDOR.
INTO THIS ARRIVES A SPACECRAFT, APPROACHING US AT HYPER SPEED,
AS IT EMERGES INTO REAL SPACE. )
(RADIO FILTER) This is the Doctor calling the pilot of the space yacht that just arrived from hyperspace. Can you hear me?
(FX: THE ROARING CRUSHING FORCE SURGES AT THE ARRIVAL OF THIS
MORSEL. )
(RADIO FILTER) Space yacht, can you hear me? There is a local gravitational force that is a danger to space traffic. Get out of here!
(FX: THERE IS A BANG. THE SHIP’S ENGINES STALL AND MISFIRE, CUTTING OUT. ITS METAL HULL STARTS TO BUCKLE. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 14. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(FX: THE CRUSHING FORCE IS AT A PEAK. THE TARDIS IS STRAINING TO KEEP ITS STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY. )
It’s being crushed...
FX: THE DOCTOR OPERATES CONSOLE INSTRUMENTS.
A single life reading on that ship. Nothing for it, we’1ll have to materialise on board. Here we go!
FX: THE DEMATERIALISATION SEQUENCE BEGINS.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 15. INT. SPACE YACHT FLIGHT DECK.
(FX: ELECTRICAL EXPLOSIONS. THE METAL STRUCTURE BUCKLING AND BREAKING. THE ROAR AND THUNDER OF THE GRAVITATIONAL ANOMALY
ANGRILY BEHIND ALL OF THIS.
THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. THE DOORS OPEN. )
(EMERGING, COUGHING IN THE SMOKE) Hello! Hello! Is there anyone
— ? Ah, there you are!
(FX: THE DOCTOR CROSSES THE METAL GRIDDED FLOOR, PUSHES SOME
ITEMS ASIDE TO GET TO A BODY.)
(CONTINUED) Hello? Can you hear me? I’m the Doctor.
(WEAK, BARELY CONSCIOUS) Doctor... ?
Can you move? Your ship’s falling apart and we don’t have much
time.
I don’t even know...
Never mind. Come on. I’1ll carry you. (HEAVES WITH THE EFFORT OF
HER UP.)
MOANS IN PAIN FROM BEING LIFTED
I apologise, but speed is of the essence. Come on.
(FX: THE DOCTOR CARRIES HER ACROSS THE METAL FLOOR. THE TARDIS DOOR CLOSES.
THE RENDING AND BUCKLING OF METAL AND THE CRESCENDO OF
REACHES A PEAK.
THE TARDIS DEMATERIALISES.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 29
A FINAL GREAT RIPPING OF METAL. THE GRAVITATIONAL FORCE ROARS. THERE IS AN OUTRUSH OF AIR INTO THE VACUUM OF SPACE.)
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 16. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
FX: TARDIS IN FLIGHT.
Well. That was close.
(MOANS IN PAIN) Where am I... ?
You’re safe now. Although your ship has broken up I’m afraid.
My ship?
Your space yacht. She came out of hyperspace straight into some kind of gravitational anomaly that was crushing local space.
Sorry, wait. What was I doing on a space yacht?
I really don’t know. I just happened to be there when you arrived.
I can’t remember...
What is your name?
WITH A START, REMEMBERING — ALMOST — BEING ASKED THIS BEFORE
What? My name?
It’s a simple question. I’m sorry. But can you remember your name?
My name... Sarra. My name is... Sarra. Yes, I’m sure.
Sarra who?
Sarra.. I don’t know. Just Sarra. Why can’t I remember?
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 31
Amnesia, presumably. There’s no sign of head trauma but that’s not exclusively a cause...
I’m scared. I can’t remember anything. Anything.
Nothing at all?
I don’t know who I am. I don’t know my full name, I don’t know why I was on a space yacht, I don’t know where I come from... I remember nothing!
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 32
SCENE _ 17. ERYS — MAIN CHAMBER.
(FX: A SPACIOUS INTERIOR ACOUSTIC WITH A SLIGHT ECHO. A DANK SPACE, FLUID DRIPPING FROM THE WALLS IN PLACES.
THE DRACHEE ENTER, THEIR FEET MOVING ON A SOFT DAMP FLOOR,
FLIP, STILL IN HER VACUUM CLOAK. )
(MUTED DRACHEE CHATTERING, HEARD INTERMITTENTLY BEHIND THE FOLLOWING)
(APPROACHING, STRUGGLING WITHIN THE CLOAK) Let. Me. Out!
(APPROACHING) All right, here.
(FX: THE VACUUM CLOAK IS RIPPED OPEN, FLIP FALLS TO THE WET GROUND, HITTING WITH A SQUELCHING THUD. )
Eugh! What’s this? Is this mud?
Get up.
(RISING) That was my plan.
FX: SHE STANDS.
This will be your home from now on.
A cave? A cave covered in goo? It’s not exactly ‘Grand Designs’.
Such a brave little girl.
Why did you bring me here?
For fun.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 33
BEAT.
Okay. Creeping me out now.
You can always try to leave.
Eh?
That tunnel is the way out. On you go. None of us will stand in
your way.
This is a trick.
You can try to leave, or you can stay.
Okay then.
FX: FLIP MOVES AWAY ON THE WET GROUND. HESITATES.
(CONTINUED) It’s dark along there...
Tunnels usually are. Hide all sorts of things. Are you going or
aren’t you?
Oh I’m going all right.
(FX: FLIP TAKES A COUPLE OF STEPS AWAY FROM US, THEN HALTS.
A SUDDEN ANIMAL HISS CLOSE BY, FOLLOWED BY AN INSECTOID RATTLE AND THE CLITTER-CLATTER OF FAST APPROACHING GIANT ARACHNID LEGS.
THE HISS AGAIN, MUCH CLOSER. THIS THING IS BEARING DOWN US.)
(CRIES OUT) No!!!
Well well. The brave little girl is afraid of spiders.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 34
A spider twice the size of me, yeah!
(FX: THE GIANT SPIDER HISSES AND CLITTER-CLATTERS, INCREDIBLY CLOSE. )
Get it away from me!!!
LAUGHS
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 35
SCENE 18. EXT. ASPHYA — A FIELD.
(FX: EXTERIOR ACOUSTIC. AN OPEN SPACE, A BREEZE BLOWING, LEAVES RUSTLING IN NEARBY TREES.
THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. ITS DOOR OPENS.)
(EMERGING) Are you well enough to walk?
(EMERGING) I’m fine. I’m just bruised, a few cuts. Where’s this?

DOCTOR WHO: A FINAL GREAT RIPPING OF METAL. THE GRAVITATIONAL FORCE ROARS. THERE IS AN OUTRUSH OF AIR INTO THE VACUUM OF SPACE.)
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 16. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
DOCTOR: Well. That was close.
SARRA: (MOANS IN PAIN) Where am I... ?
DOCTOR: You’re safe now. Although your ship has broken up I’m afraid.
SARRA: My ship?
DOCTOR: Your space yacht. She came out of hyperspace straight into some kind of gravitational anomaly that was crushing local space.
SARRA: Sorry, wait. What was I doing on a space yacht?
DOCTOR: I really don’t know. I just happened to be there when you arrived.
SARRA: I can’t remember...
DOCTOR: What is your name?
SARRA: What? My name?
DOCTOR: It’s a simple question. I’m sorry. But can you remember your name?
SARRA: My name... Sarra. My name is... Sarra. Yes, I’m sure.
DOCTOR: Sarra who?
SARRA: Sarra.. I don’t know. Just Sarra. Why can’t I remember?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 31
DOCTOR: Amnesia, presumably. There’s no sign of head trauma but that’s not exclusively a cause...
SARRA: I’m scared. I can’t remember anything. Anything.
DOCTOR: Nothing at all?
SARRA: I don’t know who I am. I don’t know my full name, I don’t know why I was on a space yacht, I don’t know where I come from... I remember nothing!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE _ 17. ERYS — MAIN CHAMBER.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: A SPACIOUS INTERIOR ACOUSTIC WITH A SLIGHT ECHO. A DANK SPACE, FLUID DRIPPING FROM THE WALLS IN PLACES.
DOCTOR WHO: THE DRACHEE ENTER, THEIR FEET MOVING ON A SOFT DAMP FLOOR,
DRAGGING: FLIP, STILL IN HER VACUUM CLOAK. )
DRACHEE: (MUTED DRACHEE CHATTERING, HEARD INTERMITTENTLY BEHIND THE FOLLOWING)
FLIP: (APPROACHING, STRUGGLING WITHIN THE CLOAK) Let. Me. Out!
TERRILL: (APPROACHING) All right, here.
TERRILL: (FX: THE VACUUM CLOAK IS RIPPED OPEN, FLIP FALLS TO THE WET GROUND, HITTING WITH A SQUELCHING THUD. )
FLIP: Eugh! What’s this? Is this mud?
TERRILL: Get up.
FLIP: (RISING) That was my plan.
TERRILL: This will be your home from now on.
FLIP: A cave? A cave covered in goo? It’s not exactly ‘Grand Designs’.
TERRILL: Such a brave little girl.
FLIP: Why did you bring me here?
TERRILL: For fun.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 33
FLIP: Okay. Creeping me out now.
TERRILL: You can always try to leave.
FLIP: Eh?
TERRILL: That tunnel is the way out. On you go. None of us will stand in
TERRILL: your way.
FLIP: This is a trick.
TERRILL: You can try to leave, or you can stay.
FLIP: Okay then.
FLIP: (CONTINUED) It’s dark along there...
TERRILL: Tunnels usually are. Hide all sorts of things. Are you going or
TERRILL: aren’t you?
FLIP: Oh I’m going all right.
FLIP: (FX: FLIP TAKES A COUPLE OF STEPS AWAY FROM US, THEN HALTS.
FLIP: A SUDDEN ANIMAL HISS CLOSE BY, FOLLOWED BY AN INSECTOID RATTLE AND THE CLITTER-CLATTER OF FAST APPROACHING GIANT ARACHNID LEGS.
FLIP: THE HISS AGAIN, MUCH CLOSER. THIS THING IS BEARING DOWN US.)
FLIP: (CRIES OUT) No!!!
TERRILL: Well well. The brave little girl is afraid of spiders.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 34
FLIP: A spider twice the size of me, yeah!
FLIP: (FX: THE GIANT SPIDER HISSES AND CLITTER-CLATTERS, INCREDIBLY CLOSE. )
FLIP: Get it away from me!!!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 18. EXT. ASPHYA — A FIELD.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: EXTERIOR ACOUSTIC. AN OPEN SPACE, A BREEZE BLOWING, LEAVES RUSTLING IN NEARBY TREES.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. ITS DOOR OPENS.)
DOCTOR: (EMERGING) Are you well enough to walk?
SARRA: (EMERGING) I’m fine. I’m just bruised, a few cuts. Where’s this?
DOCTOR: The planet Asphya, according to the Drachee. Emergency dematerialisation brought us to the nearest land mass. Rustically charming, isn’t it?
SARRA: It’s a charming enough field. Wait a minute. Your ship. The inside was... But the outside is...
DOCTOR: Well spotted. But a discussion for another time. Sarra. Asphya, does the name mean anything to you?
SARRA: Should it?
DOCTOR: You came here in that ship. Presumably for a purpose.
SARRA: No. Asphya doesn’t mean anything to me.
DOCTOR: Shame. I was hoping the association might trigger a memory.
SARRA: This is frightening. I remember nothing of my life before you saved me. I feel... hollow. How can I have no memory?
DOCTOR: It could have been caused by the attack on your ship. The effects of extreme shock.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 36
RENVAL: (FROM MIDDLE DISTANCE) You there!
DOCTOR: Oh. Hello.
RENVAL: (APPROACHING) Your faces aren’t known to me.
DOCTOR: We are visitors.
RENVAL: You are from the Great Darkness?
DOCTOR: The Great Darkness?.. Ah. If you mean outside this system, then yes.
RENVAL: We don’t have visitors on Asphya. It’s not allowed.
DOCTOR: Not allowed? By whom? The Drachee?
RENVAL: You know the Drachee?
DOCTOR: A brief acquaintance. They kidnapped a friend of mine. What can you tell me about them?
RENVAL: It isn’t safe here. We should get indoors. My village is nearby. We can talk there.
SARRA: Why isn’t it safe?
RENVAL: The Drachee might come. They see us from the sky. Come, quickly.
DOCTOR: Let’s go with him.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 37
DOCTOR: (CONTINUED) I’d like to know everything you can tell me about these Drachee. They live on your moon, yes? The moon Erys?
RENVAL: Erys is more than just a moon.
DOCTOR: Stop.
RENVAL: Yes?
DOCTOR: My friend might be up there. What do mean, more than just a moon? Is she in danger?
RENVAL: If your friend is on Erys, she is in the most terrible danger.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 38
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 19. ERYS — MAIN CHAMBER.
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: THE GIANT SPIDER, CLOSE AND THREATENING, ALL HISS AND CLICK-CLACK. )
FLIP: Get back! Get... back!!
DRACHEE: (FX: SUDDENLY, THE SPIDER VANISHES. ALL SOUNDS AND MOVEMENTS STOP. )
FLIP: (RECOVERING) What... ?
TERRILL: It wasn’t real. We placed it in your mind.
FLIP: But... I could feel it. I could feel its legs on me.
TERRILL: If we had wanted, you would have felt its jaws close on you.
FLIP: That’s cruel.
TERRILL: You see now? You aren’t going anywhere.
ERYS: (ANDROGYNOUS, REVERBERATING, ALL AROUND.) Enough.
FLIP: Who’s that?
TERRILL: (COWED) We were only having a bit of fun with her.
ERYS: You could have broken her mind. And she is of value. Child? I apologise for your treatment. My Drachee are high spirited.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 39
FLIP: Your Drachee? Look this is an awkward conversation when I can’t even see you. Why don’t you come out?
ERYS: But you can see me.
FLIP: I can?.. Where?
ERYS: I am all around you. You are within me. I am Erys. I am the chamber you are standing in, and everything on this world. I am the living moon.
FLIP: You’re the moon??
ERYS: And the Drachee are my children.
END: TITLES.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 40

elements.text: PART TWO
MUSIC: OPENING TITLES
I am all around you. You are within me. I am Erys. I am the chamber you are standing in, and everything on this world. I am the living moon.
You’re the moon??
And the Drachee are my children.
SCENE 20. ASPHYA — VILLAGE STREET.
(FX: EXTERIOR ACOUSTIC. SEVERAL VILLAGERS MOVING THROUGH ON FOOT. THIS IS A SIMPLE, PRIMITIVE SOCIETY; NOT EVEN HORSES FOR TRANSPORT.
THE DOCTOR, SARRA AND RENVAL MOVE QUICKLY ALONG THE DIRT STREET. )
Are you serious? Your moon is a living being?
Questions later. We must hurry. When you are in the open, the Drachee can get you. This is the street.
Renval, this is kind but things have changed. I need to get to Erys.
There are things you must know before you go there.
These people look so frightened. Of us.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 41
I told you, we don’t have visitors. And they fear you will bring the Drachee.
They’re really so afraid of them?
They are the bane of our lives. Here, my home. Inside.
FX: THE HEAVY WOODEN DOOR OF A COTTAGE IS OPENED.
Thank you.
FX: ALL THREE ENTER AND THE DOOR CLOSES.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 42
SCENE 21. INT. RENVAL’S COTTAGE.
(FX: A SMALL WOODEN-FLOORED LIVING SPACE. THE DOOR CLOSES,
SETS OF FOOTSTEPS MOVE ACROSS THE FLOOR. THE SCRAPE OF
CHAIRS BEING MOVED. )
Sit, please. You’1ll be safe here.
What is it we need to know about Erys?
There is great danger in travelling to the beast.
How can your moon be alive? Where did it come from?
It has always been there. It looks down on us from the heavens, and its children have their sport with us.
Its children. The Drachee are its children?
They are born from inside the creature. They do its bidding. But they are the most impudent of children.
What do you mean?
From time to time they come to Asphya to amuse themselves by harassing us. They come in their flying boxes.
The skimmers.
(FX: BEHIND THE FOLLOWING, A SOUNDTRACK TO RENVAL’S MEMORIES:
SWOOPING ON A CROWD, WHO SCREAM AND RUN IN PANIC.
HORRIFIED CRIES REACTING TO TERRIBLE IMPLANTED IMAGES. THEN AN ANGRY STRUGGLE, TWO MEN EXCHANGING BLOWS. AND THROUGHOUT, DRACHEE LAUGHING. )
They reach inside our minds and create images. Experiences. Terrible things. And pain. They can control us, and set a
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 43
neighbour to fight with neighbour, for nothing more than their pleasure.
That’s terrible.
I’ve experienced their mental powers.
And sometimes, they take people.
Take them?
When they play with our minds, it can happen that the mind breaks. When that happens, they take the person away.
What happens to them?
(A MEMORY HITS HIM, HE IS STRUCK WITH EMOTION) They are... never seen again.
Renval? I’m sorry. You lost someone, didn’t you?
BEAT.

My brother. Three seasons ago. He challenged them. Everyone knows you must never do that. They turned on him. I will never know what torments they placed in his mind. But whatever they were, they were more than he could bear.
(FX: BEHIND THE FOLLOWING: A_MAN IS WHIMPERING, HIS MIND BROKEN. THEN HE CRIES OUT AS HE IS DRAGGED OFF, INTO THE DISTANCE. )
(CONTINUED) In front of the entire village, they destroyed his mind. Then they dragged him away, took him to Erys.. I did not see him again.
I’m very sorry.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 44
If you go to Erys, Doctor, the Drachee will destroy you too.
I fought them off once. I can do it again.
You will not prevail. Not on Erys.
I have to try. For my friend. She’1ll be waiting for me to come for her.
It is probably already too late for her.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 45
SCENE 22. ERYS — MAIN CHAMBER.
I’m — I’m not afraid.
I know that you are.
I’ve been on a kind of living world before. Symbios. But that was like a.. thing. It couldn’t speak. Are you speaking? Or are you in my head?
What an astute question. I am speaking. By the use of vibrating membranes in the wall of this chamber.
Clever you.
(MENTAL PROJECTION ) (BOOMING INSIDE FLIP’S HEAD) I can also speak to you in your mind if you wish.
(WINCES, PAINED) No!.. No.
I have found that humanoids prefer to communicate this way. I use the other for... persuasion.
We like that. The persuasion.
Terrill. Get out. And take your brothers and sisters with you.
Not fair! We want to stay. We want to see what — [you do]
(MENTAL PROJECTION) GO.
(WHIMPERS, PAINED, THEN:) Yes, parent. (MOVING AWAY) Brothers, sisters, with me.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 46
(FX: THE DRACHEE TRAIPSE OUT, THEIR CHATTER RECEDING INTO THE
THEY DISAPPEAR ALONG. )
(CONTINUED) (MOVING AWAY) Not fair. No fun. We brought her here.
Now. Child.
‘Child’? Bit creepy.
I saved you for two reasons. The first was to find out why I was unable to destroy your ship, your blue capsule. Your... ah yes, TARDIS.
(FX: A SOUND WAVE, MENTAL EFFORT OF ERYS, A GENTLER VERSION OF THE FORCE USED AGAINST THE DOCTOR BY TERRILL. CONTINUING BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
What are you doing?
I am in your thoughts. I have only to ask you a question and the truth is revealed.
Don’t.
You were thinking of lying. There would have been no point. And now you are trying to conceal your thoughts. You are trying to construct a mental wall.
(CONCENTRATING) Private...
You cannot hide your thoughts and knowledge from me.
PAINED CRY
You see? The wall you tried to build collapses so easily. Ah. How interesting. The blue capsule, the TARDIS, is a time and
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 47
Space machine. And you believe it is indestructible. I doubt that.
If you say so...
And now you are thinking you might run for your life. You are thinking that with my Drachee absent you may not have to face the spider creature again.
RESIGNED SIGH
You answer your own question. You know the spider or worse will reappear. But still you consider running. Which would be foolhardy.
Stop mucking around in my head!
You have decided not to run. You harbour the hope — no, the belief — that a man will save you. A special man. The Doctor.
Why are you like this? Why attack us? Why keep me prisoner?

I act to defend myself and my children. Over the millennia many have come here. They came to lay claim to me and to Asphya. They came with plots to slay me or enslave me, to mine the minerals from my carcass, and take my children.
Do you attack every ship that comes here?
To protect my brood. Any ships that come close are a potential threat. The mining cartels of the neighbouring systems have tried many subterfuges to land their people here.
Those neighbours of yours have put up warning beacons to keep people away.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 48
Good. I want nothing to do with the people of other worlds. And I don’t want my Drachee having anything to do with them either.
If you can read my thoughts then you know I don’t mean you any harm. Hang on — you said you saved me for two reasons. What’s the other one?
The second is that you are to be integrated.
Integrated? What’s that?
(FX: THE GROUND STARTS TO MOVE. SLIMY MUSCULAR ORGANIC MATERIAL
WETLY. RIPPLING. SUCKING. )
(CONTINUED) I’m sinking .. What are you doing?!
You should not struggle. You cannot fight it. You are being drawn down into me.
(FX: THE SUCKING SLURPING PULL OF THE ORGANIC FLOOR EXERTS AN
STRONGER FORCE, DRAGGING FLIP DOWN INTO A FISSURE OF FLESH. )
(STRUGGLING) I’m not going to be your dinner!
You have a purpose more useful than as food. It will be painless, if you do not resist.
(FX: FLIP IS SCRABBLING AT THE FLOOR AS SHE IS DRAGGED DOWN, NOW AT SHOULDER DEPTH. BUT HER FINGERS CAN’T GET PURCHASE ON THE SLICK SLIMY SURFACE. )
(STRUGGLING AGAINST THE SUCTION, AND FOR BREATH) Can’t.. get a grip. NO! (MUFFLED AS SHE GOES UNDER) No!..You don’t need to do this! NO!!
(FX: FLIP FULLY SUBMERGES. HER VOICE IS CUT OFF AS THE FLESH
SHE HAS DISAPPEARED THROUGH RESEALS ITSELF WITH A WET SMACK. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 49
SCENE 23. ASPHYA — A COUNTRY PATH.
FX: APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS — THE DOCTOR, SARRA AND RENVAL.
(APPROACHING) Here we are.
FX: THE DOCTOR OPENS THE TARDIS DOOR.
We must hurry. The more I hear about Erys the more worried I become for Flip.
I’m sorry I cannot come with you, Doctor.
Oh, Renval. Of course you must stay here with your people. In fact I’m not sure it’s a good idea for you to come, Sarra. (BEAT.) Sarra?
(A SHORT DISTANCE AWAY) That moon up there. That creature. There’s something... Something tugging at my memory.
A memory of Erys?
I don’t know. But I’m going with you, Doctor. I have the strongest feeling that I’1ll find some answers up there.
If you’re sure... In you go.
FX: SARRA ENTERS THE TARDIS.
Renval, thank you for your advice. It will be invaluable.
Just keep yourself alive, Doctor. And keep your mind intact.
I’ll certainly try. Goodbye for now.
(FX: THE DOCTOR ENTERS THE TARDIS, THE DOOR CLOSES. A MOMENT, THEN THE TARDIS DEMATERIALISES. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 50
(CATCHES HIS BREATH) Truly remarkable, Doctor... Good luck.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 24. ERYS — TUNNEL.
FX: A SMALL SPACE. TERRILL’S DRACHEE ARE GATHERED.
DISCONTENTED MUTTERINGS
(FX: TERRILL WALKS TOWARDS US. THE FLOOR AGAIN IS ORGANIC AND DAMP. )
(APPROACHING) Yes, brothers and sisters, I know. It is unfair.
Our captive taken from us. To be integrated, when we could have learned from her. She could have told us of those other worlds
that our parent is so keen we should know nothing about.
AGREEMENT

We have often discussed how we are tired of being tied to the parent, of being forbidden even to talk of other worlds. Well I tell you that soon we will find a way to leave. The blue box would have been ideal. But there will be other opportunities.
CHEER
Whether the parent likes it or not, we will go. We will explore. We will make a new life, where it is we who make the decisions for ourselves.
EXCITED CHATTER
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 52
SCENE 25. ERYS — INTEGRATION CHAMBER.
(FX: A SMALL, DANK, TERRIBLE PLACE. SLIME DRIPPING FROM THE WALLS. A LARGE VAT OF THICK FLUID IS BUBBLING AND GLOOPING.
A FLESH FISSURE OPENS IN THE CEILING AND FLIP DROPS THROUGH, LANDING ON THE ORGANIC FLOOR. )
CRIES AS SHE FALLS, THEN GRUNTS ON IMPACT WITH THE FLOOR.
1: (APPROACHING) Here she is. Not much to her, is there?
2: (APPROACHING) She’ll do. She’s in one piece at least.
(RISING TO HER FEET) What is this place?
1: This is where we does the preparing.
2: You’re going to be prepared.
Prepared for what?
1: Enough talking. Get yourself over there, by the tank.
What’s that in it? Looks like... eugh.
FX: THE BUBBLING, GLOOPING LIQUID NOW CLOSER.
1: Never you mind what it is. You’re getting in it.
I’m not!
1: Ha. That’s what they all say. “No no, please don’t put me in there! Don’t put me in the tank!” (LAUGHS)
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 53
2: ‘Course in the end, they don’t have a choice.
1: (MENTAL PROJECTION ) No choice at all.
(CRIES OUT IN PAIN, FIGHTING THE MENTAL COMMAND, BEHIND THE
1: (MENTAL PROJECTION) Get in the tank, girl.

You won’t drown. The fluid will enter your body, filling your lungs and permeating your blood system. But it will sustain you in a preserved state. Alive. Aware, but immobile. Ready for the next stage.
(PAINED) Next stage? What next stage?
1: (MENTAL PROJECTION ) You’1ll see. Now climb in.
(STRAIN OF RESISTING) No... Won’t.
1: (MENTAL PROJECTION) You're fighting it well. Some do. But you’11l weaken soon.
2: I’1ll put the shackles on her.
(FX: THE RATTLE OF SHACKLES AS THE DRACHEE PICKS THEM UP AND ADVANCES ON FLIP.)
2: Don’t be any trouble while I put these on you, girl.
Why don’t you have them?! (A CRY OF EFFORT AS SHE THROWS THE
BACK AT THE DRACHEE)
2: (CRIES AS HE IS STRUCK BY THE SHACKLES.) My face!
1: You idiot! Grab her!
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 54
(RUNNING OFF) See you, you mugs!
FX: FLIP RUNS OFF DOWN A SIDE TUNNEL.
2: We’ve got to get after her.
We don’t leave the place of preparing, you know that. But it doesn’t matter, there’s nowhere she can hide. It’s only a matter of time before they pick her up and bring her back.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 55
SCENE 26. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
(FX: THE TARDIS IN FLIGHT. THE DOCTOR OPERATING CONTROLS ON THE CONSOLE. )
We’ll be there in no time.
(QUIET) Good.
Are you all right?
I thought something might have come back to me by now.
Give it time.
Even this incredible ship of yours can’t take my mind off it. This is the most amazing machine I’ve ever travelled in.

The TARDIS would thank you for saying so. And I tell you what, she has a wardrobe down the corridor. Those clothes you’re wearing are torn from when your ship was attacked. There’s time for you to change.
These’1ll do for now. I checked the pockets to see if I was carrying anything that might give me a clue to who I am.
You had no luck, I take it?
There’s this pendant, but that’s just a stone on a chain. It doesn’t suggest anything to me.
And that’s all-?
Seems like it —
(FX: SHE PATS HER CLOTHES WITH HER HANDS AS SHE SPEAKS, AND NOW HALTS. )
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 56
Hang on. What’s this?
What?
There’s something here, under the pocket, in the lining of my trousers.
In the lining?
I can feel its outline. A small square of something. It must have been stitched in there.
FX: A SHORT RIP OF FABRIC.
(CONTINUED) It’s a phototablet... Why would I — ? Oh.
What’s the photograph?
Two children. Girls. No older than eleven or twelve. Cute things. Blonde. (A SUDDEN GASP, THE SHOCK OF REALISATION)
Sarra??
They’re my children! They’re my daughters!
You remember?
I’m a mother! I’m a mother to... Jen and Mya. That’s who they are — Jen and Mya! Oh Gods, how could I have forgotten I was a mother?
And why did you have a phototablet of them hidden in the lining of your trousers?
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 57
It makes no sense.
What else can you remember? Do you know where you’re from? Do you remember their father?
I don’t... I can’t...
(RADIO FILTER - IN SARRA’S HEAD) Stop!!
(FRIGHTENED) What? Who’s that?
(RADIO FILTER - IN SARRA’S HEAD) Remember nothing else!
Sarra, what are you talking about?
(RADIO FILTER - IN SARRA’S HEAD) You have a purpose here. You have a plan. Stick to the plan.
Who are you? Where are you? What plan?
Sarra, who are you talking to?
Can you hear that?
Hear what?
(RADIO FILTER - IN SARRA’S HEAD)
Do not let this Doctor know you can hear me. It could ruin everything. Trust me. You know you can trust my voice. You know this.
It was.. nothing. Just talking to myself.
Let me have a look at you.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 58
(RADIO FILTER - IN SARRA’S HEAD)
Do not trust him. Trust only my voice.
I’m not crazy.
I’m not suggesting you are.
FX: THE TARDIS ENGINES GO THROUGH THEIR LANDING CYCLE.
Have we arrived?
Yes, but I really think you should let me examine — [you]
(COLLECTING HERSELF, CALMING DOWN) No. We have to get out there
and find your friend.
Of course. Just let me know if you feel unwell.
FX: THE TARDIS DOORS OPEN.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 59
SCENE 27. EXT. ERYS — SURFACE.
(FX: A BLEAK LANDSCAPE. THERE IS A WIND LIKE A WHISPERED WAIL. THE GROUND IS HARD AND GRITTY UNDERFOOT.
THE TARDIS DOOR OPENS. THE DOCTOR AND SARRA STEP OUT.)
Welcome to Erys. Not the most hospitable of environments.
STILL A LITTLE DISTRACTED FROM HEARING THE VOICE IN HER EAR
Is that the sound of the creature?
That’s the wind. It makes that sound as it passes through those fissures in the surface. Unsettling, isn’t it?
This is really a living being? It looks like... well, it looks like a planet should look. It has geological features. Hills, cliffs, even vegetation. The ground is solid.

Living planets are a mixture of flesh and mineral, encased within a solid carapace. Be grateful for it. It means the creature is unlikely to realise that we’re here. And the other features are growths that have developed on the carapace.
And the vegetation?
Fungus.
Oh nice.
(FX: THE DOCTOR CLOSES THE TARDIS DOOR AND STRIDES OFF, BEHIND THE FOLLOWING. )
But come on. We have to find Flip, and to do that we’ll have to find some way of communicating with this creature. We should look for a way underground.
We'll find a way if we head for the cliffs.
THE BROOD OF ERYS by Andrew Smith (NB FINAL) Page 60
FX: THE DOCTOR COMES TO A HALT.
Will we? How do you know?
(CONFUSED) I.. I don’t know why I said that. It just came to me.
You know this place?
No... I don’t know. Maybe. But how could I?
It’s possible. In fact, it might offer an explanation for your amnesia. If you’ve met the Drachee before and they’ve affected your mind.
That’s an unpleasant thought.

Because the Drachee and the mud creatures have independent existence. The Asphyans were sustained by signals from the Erys moon. Coming into the transdimensional environment of the
broke the connection.

Flip.

(EMERGING) Do you never stop with the platitudes, Doctor?

Sarra?

GRUNTS AS HE HITS THE FLOOR.

Yes, it’s — [her father]

You do?

(WEAK, BUT HAPPY AT HER RECOLLECTION) Hello Sarra.

It won’t hurt you. If I just place it against your forehead...

Restoring my daughter’s life to her. Don’t worry, I know what I’m doing. I’m an encephalic surgeon.

Your memories will return to you now. Give it a few minutes and you should remember everything.
(CAUTIONARY) Whatever you remember, Erys will become aware of ate
Erys already knows. It read my mind, on the ship.
Yes. I know exactly why you came here, Sarra Vanser, and who you are.
Vanser. Yes, that’s right.. I’m Sarra Vanser.

I.. (REMEMBERING) Oh no. NO! (CRIES)

Her children.

Elgin. What happened?

It may be illegal to visit this system, but a living planet is quite a tourist attraction. There are illicit ‘tours’ run by unscrupulous entrepreneurs. Sarra’s husband Levek arranged to bring the girls on one of these tours, months ago.
(MEMORIES FLOODING BACK) It was a birthday treat for Jen. Yes.
The tour ship never returned. There was a distress call saying they were crashing on Erys, then nothing.
I.. yes, I remember it all. I went to the authorities to demand they send a rescue mission.
Do you remember coming to see me after?
I... Yes! Yes, I came to your apartment.
